MyTardis API - Java Client

This package implements a Java client for the MyTardis API.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.mytardis.api.client  
org.mytardis.api.model  

This package implements a Java client for the MyTardis API. It contains two sub-packages:

org.mytardis.api.client

Includes the classes for building, posting, and retrieving objects from MyTardis.

Experiments are built using the ExperimentTree, DatasetTree, and DatafileTree classes---each of which can have associated meta-data parameters. Trees take a TardisClient instance as a constructor parameter---which handles the interaction with the MyTardis RESTful interface.

Trees can be validated individually using an associated checkTree() method. Alternatively, the ExperimentTree.verify() method can be used to execute all checkTree() methods in an experiment and aggregate any errors that they generate. This verify() method must validate successfully---with no errors---for the ExperimentTree.post() method to push the experiment, datasets, and datafiles to the MyTardis system. See ExperimentTree.verify() for details of which attributes are required and which are optional for each tree.

A TardisClient can be used to retrieve TardisObject instances for a given model, either as a list or individually---by Id or ResourceURI.

org.mytardis.api.model

Includes the object models generated from the MyTardis API schema. Objects are generated using the jsonschema2pojo utility, using the following parameters: source type is "JSON", and annotation style is "Gson".

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nick May.
